instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-4924: What is 820-4924? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PP5V_S3: What is PP5V_S3? PP5V_S3 is a 5v power rail present when the system is in an S3 suspend to RAM state..
definitions.DDRREG_EN: What is DDRREG_EN? DDRREG_EN is an enable signal that turns on power rails for DDR memory.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Beep RAM
threads.message:
I did reballing the 4 memories, in the tests it worked normally, but after almost a day the mac turned off and presented a memory beep.
. Tell me it's not CPU. :(


Voltage: L7430 0V.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Beep RAM
threads.message:
"Voltage: L7430 0V"
Solve this first.
Short, or low value to ground at L7430?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Beep RAM
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Beep RAM
threads.message:
Seems that you do not understand the difference between diode mode and voltage range of multimeter.
0.133 on diode mode is correct value.

Post <CHIP>U7400</CHIP> voltages; pins 12, 16, 17, 6.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Beep RAM
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Beep RAM
threads.message: Replaced the <CHIP>U7400</CHIP> and <TRANSISTOR>Q7430</TRANSISTOR>, checked the <RESISTOR>R7425</RESISTOR>/C are ok, I imagine CPU is the defect ?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Beep RAM
threads.message:
"12    <SIGNAL>PP5V_S3</SIGNAL> 0v"
Do you really get beep error without voltage at L7520???

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Beep RAM
threads.message:
It was measuring with the board out of the housing, it was giving 0V in the L7430, now I measured in the coil is giving 1.2V.
I imagine it is CPU, because I made reball Memories ?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Beep RAM
threads.message: Coukd be CPU issue, or bad solders at RAM chips.
